body.p: To address some apparent conflicts between the control approach and the risks-and-rewards approach, the Board explained in the 2018 Conceptual Framework that:

li.p: if an entity has apparently transferred an asset but retains exposure to significant positive or negative variations in the amount of economic benefits that may be produced by the asset, this sometimes indicates that the entity might continue to control that asset; and
if an entity has transferred an asset to another party that holds the asset as an agent for the entity, the transferor still controls the asset.
